item.title: How to Contribute to Ruby on Rails
item.description: Are you looking for an opportunity to get more experience as a developer? Make meaningful connections with the community? Learn the best practices on how to maintain a large codebase? What if you could get that experience by contributing to an open source project like Rails? If that sounds scary, don’t worry! We can help you! By the end of this post, you’ll learn 5 ways to become a new Rails contributor, even if you are a beginner.

item.title: Open Source Thursdays Expert Session with Rafael França on Aug 5th
item.description: Rafael França is a Rails Core team member and Principal Engineer at Shopify, and he is working to define the future of Ruby and Rails. Rafael explained how to get started with contributing to Ruby on Rails, fix a bug, navigate the Rails code base and contribute to open source projects as a beginner. He also answered questions from the community. Open Source Thursdays is a project from hexdevs to make Open Source contributions more inclusive.

item.title: Open Source Thursdays
item.description: What is Open Source Thursdays? Did you always want to contribute to Rails but can’t get past getting overwhelmed and scared when looking at a big project by yourself? That’s how we felt! We thought, why not do it live so other people can join us? Neither of us has done this before. The plan is to get there and do everything live, no preparing in advance. Just the real work.

item.title: A JIT compiler for Ruby with Aaron Patterson (Sept 30th @ 2 PM PT)
item.description: TenderJIT: A Pure Ruby JIT Compiler for Ruby On September 30th at 2 PM PT, Aaron Patterson (@tenderlove) will join our livestream as an expert guest. RSVP here. Aaron Patterson is a Senior Staff Engineer working at Shopify where he is focusing on Ruby core and Rails core development. Besides his achievements in software (which are both numerous and great), he is known for his humility, kindness, and accomplishments in the field of bio-writing.
